subject: RE: [junit] Reloading tests with text runner?
msgSnippet: You should be able to answer this question yourself within ten minutes by running JUnit with a debugger. Eclipse has a good one and its free. There are others
messageBody:
You should be able to answer this question yourself within ten minutes
by running JUnit with a debugger. Eclipse has a good one and its free.
There are others as well.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ranjeet Sahay [mailto:rsahay@...]
> Sent: Friday, September 05, 2003 10:18 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Reloading tests with text runner?
>
>
> Hi,
> Good point to note. I have similar setup for running
> Testcases from JUnit SwingUI. Even through I have checked
> "Reload classes every run" It doesnot not bother to reload
> the classes for next run. I have packed all my class files
> inside a jar and run the tests. Changing the testcase and
> updating jar files and then rerunning the same testcase
> doesnot reflect the the changes. I have to explicitly stop
> the UI and then do rerun.
>
> WHY???
>
> Thanks.
>
> Ranjeet Sahay
>
